Name: Statue of Ranefer with a Short Haircut
Description: The statue depicts Ranefer, standing and is wearing an overlapped kilt of medium length. His hair was cut short and the eyes are painted.This splendid statue was found together with another statue, almost identical, in two niches in the chapel at his tomb at Saqqara. This one shows him in an old age while the other in the flush of youth.Ranefer was the high priest of Ptah and Soker at Memphis; he was also in charge of supervising the artists and artisans of the royal workshops
